questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage site is famous for its well-preserved Roman aqueduct, completed around the 1st century AD and spans over the Gardon River in southern France?
questions.context: This ancient aqueduct bridge is a remarkable example of Roman engineering and is a popular tourist attraction today.

questions.question: What modern architectural marvel in Dubai held the title of the world's tallest structure and skyscraper since its completion in 2010?
questions.context: At over 828 meters tall, this iconic tower is a standout in Dubai's skyline and includes an observation deck offering unparalleled views of the city.

questions.question: Which historical battle site in Belgium was the location of Napoleon Bonaparte's final defeat in 1815?
questions.context: The Battle of Waterloo marked the end of the Napoleonic Wars and significantly shaped European history.

questions.question: Known for housing the famous 'Mona Lisa', what is the name of this iconic museum located in the heart of Paris, France?
questions.context: The Louvre is the world's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris, and its glass pyramid entrance is recognized worldwide.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin site in Jordan is famous for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system, known as the Rose City due to the color of the stone from which it is carved?
questions.context: Established as early as 312 BC, Petra was the capital of the Nabataean Kingdom and is one of the most visited tourist sites in the world.
